disclaimer: This page is intended as a demo and should not be used for medical advice.
info_1: AI = Artificial Intelligence / ML = Machine Learning
info_2: This page demonstrates a custom entry form that allows values to be submitted to a AI/ML Binary Classification Web service built with Python using [scikit-learn] and Logistic Regression.
info_3: Binary Classification (true/false, 1/0, yes/no, etc.) is a common technique for Apps that need to make a prediction using Machine Learning.
info_4: Calculations for predictions are based on a mathematical model which is created from historical values with a known result.
info_5: Logistic Regression is the statistical model chosen for this dataset.
info_6: This specific example uses a model built from a well-studied dataset “Pima Indians Diabetes Database” to predict if a patient has diabetes or does not have diabetes. This dataset is widely used in introductory Machine Learning examples and it’s a good starting point to learn core concepts of Machine Learning.
info_7: The standard [entryForm.js] file is used to handle data downloading and submitting through HTML and Templating without the need for extra JavaScript code.
info_8: A custom page [binaryPredictionPage] defined in [binary-classification.js] is used to extend [entryForm.js] and add logic for defining new random values.
training_info: Here are 10 example records (out of 768 total records) that were used to develop the model.
